(I) Countries with debt to GNP ratios greater than 40 per cent are classified for purposes of this table as having 'substantial external debts'. This is an arbitrary measure which does not necessarily mean that the countries concerned are experiencing debt difficulties. The table does not include some countries that may have debt to GNP ratios exceeding 40 per cent but for which reliable data are not publicly available.
